content: magdiego s tunisian smock stitch baby blanket pattern notes tunisian should be worked loosely as it makes a fairly dense fabric this stitch doesn t have as much issue with curl as some stitches however avoid changing skeins in the middle of a row it will be easier to weave ends in the border you can make the blanket any size you like just begin with an even number of stitches for the last stitch in a row work tss through both the front and back vertical bars for a neater end materials 3 skeins lion brand cotton ease almond mc 1 skein lion brand cotton ease lime cc tunisian/afghan crochet hook size i or 5 5mm crochet hook size h or 5 0mm tapestry needle finished size approximately 28 x28 tunisian simple stitch - insert the hook from right to left behind the next vertical bar and yarn over draw a loop through return row yarn over and pull through one loop on hook * yarn over and pull through two loops on hook repeat from * until one loop remains on the hook back loop linked treble bllt insert hook in the back camel hump right below the working end of the yarn yarn over and pull loop through insert hook into next camel hump yarn over and pull loop through insert hook into next stitch yarn over and pull loop through 4 loops on hook yarn over and pull through 2 loops 3 times row 1 with mc chain 100 starting the second chain from the hook insert hook yarn over and pull through *insert hook into next chain yarn over and pull loop through repeat from * to the end of the chain you should have 100 loops on your hook work return row as usual row 2 pull the yarn to the front of the hook and skipping the first vertical bar insert the hook in the next 2 vertical bars see fig 1 let the yarn fall forward and down yarn over and pull through both stitches 2 loops on hook *pull the yarn in front of the hook again and yarn over twice from front to back see fig 2 insert into next 2 vertical bars let the yarn fall forward and down see fig 3 yarn over and pull through both vertical bars you should have 4 loops on hook repeat from * until one vertical bar remains pull the yarn to the front of the hook and over the top of the hook hold the yarn on the hook see fig 4 while working the last vertical bar as tunisian simple stitch you should have the same number of loops on your hook as you started with work return row as usual row 3 skipping the first and second vertical bar *yarn over hook twice insert hook into next 2 vertical bars one stitch from each pair from the previous row let the yarn fall forward and down yarn over and
